next to.translation[0].definitions[0].de: very close to someone or something, with no other person, building, place etc in between
next to.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: There was a little girl sitting next to him.
next to.translation[0].definitions[1].de: used to give a list of things you like, hate etc in order to say what is first on the list
next to.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Next to soccer, I like playing tennis best.
next to.translation[0].definitions[2].de: in comparison with someone or something
next to.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Next to her, I’m a very poor cook.
next to.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: next to
very close to someone or something, with no other person, building, place etc in between
I sat next to him at dinner.
The hotel was right next to the airport.
beside
next to the side of someone or something
Ella came and sat down beside me.
They were sitting beside the pool.
by
next to something – often used about being very close to a window, door, or the edge of something such as an area of water
I saw him standing by the window.
Weymouth is a pretty little town by the sea.
She lives by the river.
next door
in the building or room next to yours, or next to another one
The house next door is much bigger than ours.
Have you met the people who’ve just moved in next door?
alongside
close to the side of something, especially a river, railway, boat, or vehicle
I decided to take the path alongside the railway track.
A police car pulled up alongside.
adjacent
a building, room, or piece of land that is adjacent to another one is next to it
They walked through a rose garden adjacent to the hospital.
The blaze spread to two adjacent buildings.
adjoining
an adjoining room, building, or piece of land is one that is next to another one and is joined to it
We had adjoining rooms at the hotel.
